title: Former World Boxing Champion Ricky Hatton Dies at 46
snippets: British boxing icon Ricky Hatton has died at 46, sparking tributes from across sport.
Former world champion Ricky Hatton, nicknamed "The Hitman," has been found dead at his Manchester home, just weeks after revealing plans to return to the ring in December.
The British authorities said that the boxer, who retired in 2012, was found unresponsive at a home in Greater Manchester.
Ricky Hatton, the former world boxing champion who rose to become one of the most popular fighters in the sport, has died. He was 46.
titles: Former boxing world champion Ricky Hatton dies aged 46
UK boxer Ricky Hatton dies at 46 after comeback announcement
Ricky Hatton, British Boxer and Former World Champion, Is Dead
Ricky Hatton, former world boxing champion, dies at 46
summary: Former world boxing champion Ricky Hatton has passed away at the age of 46. Known for his all-action style and success in the light welterweight and welterweight divisions, Hatton was a celebrated figure in British boxing. He was found unresponsive at a residence in Greater Manchester. Hatton, nicknamed the Hitman, retired in 2012 and leaves behind a legacy as one of the most beloved British fighters of his generation. Tributes from the boxing community and fans are pouring in to honor his memory.

title: Eagles Defeat Chiefs in Week 2, Chiefs Face Early-Season Slump
snippets: NFL Nation reporters react to all the action, answering the biggest questions coming out of each game. Here's what we learned from Week 2.
Highlights from the Week 2 matchup between the Philadelphia Eagles and the Kansas City Chiefs during the 2025 NFL season.

It wasn’t quite the Super Bowl beatdown that happened in February, but the Chiefs loss to the Eagles on Sunday has Kansas City in an unfamiliar position to start an NFL season.

Kellen Forrest has that and more in his takeaways from Week 2.
titles: Takeaways from every NFL Week 2 game: Eagles defeat Chiefs in Super Bowl rematch; Cowboys win in OT
Chiefs remain winless after Super Bowl rematch with Eagles
NFL Week 2 Takeaways: Eagles stymie Mahomes again, put Chiefs in early hole
summary: In Week 2 of the 2025 NFL season, the Philadelphia Eagles defeated the Kansas City Chiefs, leaving the Chiefs in an unusual early-season slump. NFL Nation reporters provided insights and reactions to this game among other matchups, highlighting key takeaways from the action.

Kathy Hochul backs Zohran Mamdani in race for New York City mayor
summary: New York Governor Kathy Hochul has endorsed Zohran Mamdani, a democratic socialist advocating for rent increases for the wealthiest New Yorkers. This endorsement comes despite Donald Trump's comment on Mamdani's 22-point lead in polls, referring to it as a 'rebellion against bad candidates'.

title: Utah Man Arrested in Shooting Death of Activist Charlie Kirk
snippets: He adds that "much more evidence and information" will become available once charges are filed in the case.
Gov. Spencer Cox, R-Utah, said Sunday that the suspect in the shooting that killed conservative activist Charlie Kirk is not cooperating with authorities.
Officials arrested 22-year-old Tyler Robinson on Friday in connection with Charlie Kirk's death. Utah Gov. Spencer Cox said he has not confessed.
titles: Kirk suspect 'not co-operating' with authorities, governor says
Utah governor says alleged Kirk shooter not cooperating with authorities
Utah Gov. Spencer Cox says suspect in Charlie Kirk's death 'is not cooperating'
summary: Utah Governor Spencer Cox announced that 22-year-old Tyler Robinson was arrested for the shooting death of conservative activist Charlie Kirk. Cox stated that Robinson is not cooperating with authorities and emphasized that more information will be available after charges are filed. He also mentioned that Robinson had been "radicalized" and was in a relationship with an individual transitioning from male to female. Robinson has yet to confess to the crime.

title: Canada Launches $13B Plan for 4,000 New Homes on Federal Sites
snippets: The newly created Build Canada Homes agency will oversee plans to build 4,000 homes on six federally owned sites, Prime Minister Mark Carney said Sunday.

OTTAWA — The newly created Build Canada Homes agency will oversee plans to build 4,000 homes on six federally owned sites, as part of a $13 billion agency budget to speed up affordable home building, Prime Minister Mark Carney said Sunday. Carney said that the $13 billion will offer financial incent
titles: Build Canada Homes aims to build 4,000 housing units on federal land: Carney
Build Canada Homes aims to build 4,000 housing units on federal land: Carney
summary: The Build Canada Homes agency, recently established, is set to manage the construction of 4,000 homes across six federally owned sites, announced Prime Minister Mark Carney. This initiative, part of a $13 billion budget, aims to accelerate the development of affordable housing in Canada.

title: Ontario Liberal Leader Crombie Stays After 57% Vote Against Leadership Race
snippets: Crombie initially said she planned to stay on as leader, adding that a leadership race right now would do more harm than good for the party.

Ontario Liberal Leader Bonnie Crombie is indicating she will stay on as leader, after party delegates voted against having a new leadership race — though only narrowly. Voting was taking place through the weekend at the party’s annual general meeting in Toronto and 57 per cent of delegates sai
titles: Bonnie Crombie to resign as Ontario Liberal leader after weak show of support
Bonnie Crombie vows to stay on as Ontario Liberal leader despite weak vote of support
summary: Ontario Liberal Leader Bonnie Crombie will remain in her position after 57% of party delegates voted against initiating a new leadership race during the party's annual general meeting in Toronto. Crombie had previously stated that a leadership race at this time would be detrimental to the party.

title: Bengals QB Joe Burrow May Need Surgery for Turf Toe, Out Most of Season
snippets: Cincinnati Bengals star quarterback Joe Burrow is dealing with a turf toe injury that could require surgery, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter on Sunday night.
The Cincinnati Bengals are set to be without their top quarterback for most of the season.
titles: Sources: Burrow could need surgery for turf toe
Report: Bengals’ Burrow could miss 3 months with turf toe injury
summary: Cincinnati Bengals quarterback Joe Burrow is facing a turf toe injury that may need surgery, according to ESPN's Adam Schefter. As a result, the Bengals are expected to be without their leading quarterback for the majority of the season.

title: Scottie Scheffler Wins Procore Championship, Secures 6th PGA Victory
snippets: Scottie Scheffler closed with a 5-under 67 to win the Procore Championship for his sixth PGA Tour victory of the year.
Scheffler came from behind once again as the Americans shined in a tune-up before the Ryder Cup
titles: Scheffler secures sixth win in Ryder Cup tuneup
Scottie Scheffler edges Ben Griffin at Procore Championship for sixth victory of 2025 as Ryder Cup nears
summary: Scottie Scheffler won the Procore Championship with a final round of 5-under 67, marking his sixth PGA Tour victory of the year. He achieved this win by coming from behind, showcasing American talent ahead of the Ryder Cup.

title: PM Denounces Flag Misuse at Far-Right Rally Urged by Musk
snippets: The prime minister said the flag represents "our diverse country" and he will not allow people to feel intimidated.
Antifascist campaign group Hope Not Hate condemns speeches at Saturday's rally in London as 'extremely disturbing'.

Exclusive: PM condemns attacks against police, racist intimidation of minorities and use of flag to instil fear

  • What England’s flag-hoiste
titles: We will never surrender our flag, Sir Keir Starmer says
Starmer says UK will ‘never surrender’ flag to far-right protesters
Britain will ‘never surrender flag’ to far-right protesters, Starmer says
summary: The Prime Minister condemned the use of the national flag to instill fear and racist intimidation at a rally organized by a far-right activist, which Elon Musk urged Brits to 'fight back or die' at. The PM emphasized the flag's representation of the country's diversity and denounced attacks against police and minorities. The antifascist group Hope Not Hate labeled speeches at the London event as 'extremely disturbing.'

title: Backup QB Jake Browning Leads Bengals to Victory Amid Burrow Injury Concerns

Burrow's latest injury could be a costly one for Cincinnati

Joe Burrow turf toe: Who is Jake Browning, what does he bring, and who needs to step up for Bengals?
summary: Jake Browning, stepping in as backup, led the Bengals to a victory on Sunday. The team faces uncertainty regarding the extent and impact of a recent injury to starting quarterback Joe Burrow.

title: Manchester City Triumphs 3-0 Over United in Derby Showdown
snippets: Man City outclassed Man United in Sunday's derby, fully deserving their 3-0 win. Here's what you need to know from the fun at the Etihad.
Which players and managers will be happy, or disappointed, with how the Manchester derby played out?
Entering Manchester City’s 3-nil win over Manchester United, the challenge was there for Jeremy Doku to step up on the big occasion. With Omar Marmoush out of yesterday’s match with a knee injury,...
titles: Manchester derby reaction: How City beat United, Donnarumma and Haaland dazzle, more
Winners and losers, as Manchester City demolished Manchester United in the derby
A Manchester City winger did everything he had to do against Manchester United
summary: Manchester City secured a 3-0 victory over Manchester United in the Manchester derby at the Etihad Stadium. The win was a significant display of City's superiority in the match. Jeremy Doku stepped up in the absence of Omar Marmoush, who missed the game due to a knee injury. The outcome leaves City's players and managers satisfied, while United's team will likely be disappointed with their performance.

title: Blue Jays Sweep Orioles 11-2, Bieber Dominates on Mound
snippets: Shane Bieber surrendered one run in six innings, and Ernie Clement and George Springer knocked in two runs apiece to help the Toronto Blue Jays to an 11-2 win to sweep the Baltimore Orioles on Sunday.

Sunday afternoon at Rogers Centre, there was a distinct feeling of possibility around the Blue Jays.

After a sweep of the Orioles, there is real a sense of momentum around this team.

George Springer’s phenomenal season continued for the Toronto Blue Jays, going three-for-five from the plate with a home run and two RBIs as the Blue Jays completed the sweep of the Baltimore Orioles with an 11-2 win.
titles: Blue Jays beat Orioles 11-2 to complete sweep
Blue Jays tighten grasp on first place in AL East with sweep of Orioles
MLB Highlights: Blue Jays 11, Orioles 2
summary: Shane Bieber pitched six innings, allowing only one run, while Ernie Clement and George Springer each contributed two RBIs in the Toronto Blue Jays' 11-2 victory over the Baltimore Orioles. This win completed a series sweep on Sunday. George Springer notably went three-for-five, hitting a home run. The win at Rogers Centre has bolstered the Blue Jays' momentum.

title: Starmer Plans 12 Modular Nuclear Reactors in Hartlepool to Attract Investors
snippets: Key among the plans is a proposal to build up to 12 advanced modular nuclear reactors in Hartlepool.
Sir Keir Starmer hopes to move on from scandals and showcase Britain’s appeal to foreign investors
titles: UK and US unveil nuclear energy deal ahead of Trump visit
US-UK nuclear energy accord unveiled ahead of Trump state visit
summary: Sir Keir Starmer has announced plans to build up to 12 advanced modular nuclear reactors in Hartlepool, aiming to shift focus from scandals and highlight Britain's attractiveness to foreign investors.

title: China's Economic Slowdown Deepens in August, Missing Targets
snippets: China's economic slowdown deepened in August with a raft of key indicators missing expectations amid sluggish domestic demand and Beijing's anti-involution campaign.
Beijing has struggled to fully reignite the world's number two economy since the end of the COVID-19 pandemic.
titles: China's economic slowdown deepens in August with retail sales, industrial output missing expectations
China’s economy continues to stumble as industry output, retail sales disappoint
summary: China's economic slowdown worsened in August, with key indicators like domestic demand falling short of expectations. Despite efforts, Beijing has been unable to fully boost the economy post-COVID-19.

title: Emergency Summit Held on Israeli Attack in Doha, Draft Resolution Condemns Act
snippets: A draft resolution reportedly says Israeli "hostile acts" threaten peace in the Middle East.
The Qatari PM was at an emergency international summit to discuss a joint response after the Israeli attack in Doha.
titles: Qatar hosts Arab-Islamic emergency summit over Israeli strike on Doha
Video: Qatari PM condemns Israeli attack ahead of emergency summit
summary: An emergency international summit was convened, with Qatar's Prime Minister in attendance, to discuss a collective response to an Israeli attack in Doha. A draft resolution from the summit indicates that Israeli "hostile acts" are perceived as threats to peace in the Middle East.

title: Liberty Wins Game 1 Against Mercury 76-69, Stewart Injured
snippets: The Liberty struggled to take care of the ball in the regular season, and that continued on Sunday

Natasha Cloud scored 23 points, Breanna Stewart added 18 before hurting her knee in overtime and the New York Liberty beat the Phoenix Mercury 76-69 on Sunday in Game 1 of their best-of-three first-round playoff series.
titles: Liberty survive Game 1 OT thriller, but Breanna Stewart injury and sloppy play put title defense in question
Liberty beat Mercury in Game 1 but lose Stewart to injury
summary: The New York Liberty defeated the Phoenix Mercury 76-69 in Game 1 of their first-round playoff series, despite struggles with ball handling. Natasha Cloud led with 23 points, while Breanna Stewart scored 18 before injuring her knee in overtime.

title: Monkees Songwriter Bobby Hart Dies in Los Angeles
snippets: Bobby Hart teamed with Tommy Boyce on such hits as "Last Train to Clarksville" and "I'm Not Your Steppin' Stone."

Hart, who wrote and produced for years with Tommy Boyce, died in his Los Angeles home after a period of poor health

Bobby Hart, a key part of the Monkees’ multimedia empire who teamed with Tommy Boyce on such hits as Last Train to
titles: Bobby Hart, who co-wrote 'Last Train to Clarksville' and other Monkees hits, dies
Bobby Hart, co-writer of Monkees hits like Last Train to Clarksville, dies aged 86
summary: Bobby Hart, known for co-writing hits like "Last Train to Clarksville" and "I'm Not Your Steppin' Stone" with Tommy Boyce for the Monkees, has passed away in his Los Angeles home after a period of poor health. Hart's contributions were integral to the success of the Monkees' multimedia empire.

When Fox analyst Greg Olsen noted that this week’s version of Russell Wilson was “unrecognizable from Week
titles: The New York Giants are 0-2 again. But are they finally ... watchable?
The New York Giants are 0-2 again. But are they finally ... watchable?
summary: Russell Wilson's team faced a loss to the Cowboys in their season opener, marked by both sloppy mistakes and notable offensive moments. Fox analyst Greg Olsen remarked that Wilson's performance was vastly different from the previous week, highlighting inconsistency.

title: "Adolescence" Wins Big at 2025 Emmys; "Severance" Takes Two Acting Awards
snippets: The Netflix drama, starring Owen Cooper, explored the impact of smartphones on teenagers.
The Netflix drama “Adolescence,” starring Stephen Graham, Owen Cooper and Erin Doherty, was a big winner at the 2025 Emmy Awards Sunday night. How many Emmys did the series win overall?

"Severance" took a pair of major acting statuettes at the 2025 Primetime Emmy Awards Sunday night in Los Angeles, but the series fell short for in its bid for the top award in its category. How many Emmys did it win overall?
titles: How Adolescence pulled off an awards sweep
How Many Emmy Awards Did ‘Adolescence’ Win At The 2025 Emmys?
How Many Emmy Awards Did ‘Severance’ Win At The 2025 Emmys?
summary: The Netflix drama "Adolescence," featuring Stephen Graham, Owen Cooper, and Erin Doherty, won big at the 2025 Emmy Awards, though the exact number of Emmys won is not specified. Meanwhile, "Severance" secured two major acting awards at the same event but did not win the top prize in its category.

title: Penske Media Sues Google Over Forced AI Summaries Use
snippets: Penske Media, owner of Rolling Stone, Billboard, and Variety, has sued Google over AI Overviews in a landmark antitrust case that could reshape digital media.
Penske's lawsuit accuses Google of abusing its monopoly power in search to force publishers to support AI summaries.
titles: Why Rolling Stone Owner Penske Media Just Declared War On Google
Rolling Stone owner Penske Media sues Google over AI summaries
summary: Penske Media Corporation, owner of Rolling Stone and The Hollywood Reporter, has filed a lawsuit against Google, accusing it of abusing its monopoly power by forcing publishers to adopt AI summaries. This marks the first major legal action by an American media company against Google over AI summaries.

title: 77th Primetime Emmy Awards Hosted by Nate Bargatze on September 14
snippets:
Adolescence, Severance, Hacks and The Studio lead award tally with surprise win for Somebody Somewhere

titles: Emmys 2025: full list of winners
Emmys 2025 Full Winners List (Live Updates)
summary: The 77th Primetime Emmy Awards, hosted by Nate Bargatze, are taking place in Los Angeles on September 14, 2025. Shows like Severance, The Studio, The White Lotus, and Adolescence are highlighted as significant contenders. The event will announce winners in categories such as Best Drama, Best Comedy, and top acting honors. Winners are being updated live.

title: Lough Neagh Faces Third Year of Toxic Algae Due to Farm Pollution
snippets:
Signs tout a natural paradise, but pollution from over-farming has left Northern Ireland’s Lough Neagh choked by toxic algae

The bright, cheery signs dot the shoreline like epistles from another era, a time before the calamity.

“Ballyronan marina is a picturesque boating and tourist f
For the third year running toxic blue-green algae blooms that look like pea soup and smell like rotten eggs have covered much of Lough Neagh, the largest lake in the UK and Ireland.
titles: ‘It’s dying in front of our eyes’: how the UK’s largest lake became an ecological disaster
UK's largest lake 'dying' as algae blooms worsen
summary: Lough Neagh, the UK and Ireland's largest lake, is experiencing its third consecutive year of toxic blue-green algae blooms, caused by pollution from over-farming. Despite signs promoting it as a natural paradise, the lake is now choked with algae that resembles pea soup and emits a rotten egg smell, impacting its status as a picturesque boating and tourist destination.

title: Trump, S. Korean President Criticize Raid, Cite Investment Fears
snippets: In a post on his Truth Social platform, Trump wrote: "I don't want to frighten off or disincentivize investment."
South Korean President Lee Jae Myung called the raid "bewildering" and warned Thursday that the raid could discourage future investment.
titles: Trump says he doesn’t want to ‘frighten off’ investors as ICE Hyundai raid sparks Korean outrage
After his ICE agents arrested hundreds of South Korean workers, Trump says he doesn’t want to ‘frighten off’ foreign investment in the U.S.
summary: Former President Donald Trump expressed concerns on Truth Social about discouraging investment following a raid. South Korean President Lee Jae Myung also criticized the raid, suggesting it could deter future investments, describing the action as "bewildering."
